intro: Romulea clusiana var. minor, commonly known as the lesser romulea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant produces delicate, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, pale yellow to orange flowers. It typically blooms in late summer to early autumn, and its flowers have a subtle, sweet fragrance. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
